title: Javascript developer for MOOC interactive visualisations
place: Digital Learning Hub | Imperial College London
description: Worked with the Digital Learning Hub at Imperial College London to develop interactive visualisations for the upcoming online masters course in Machine London that is currently being devloped by Imperial College London. This mainly involved Javascript development and backend web devlopment. I used javascript to create useful visualisations that could improve understanding of complex mathematical ideas such as the effects of different types of regularisation techniques or how different machine learning algorithms work.

title: Lead Engineer - SensUS Competition 2018
place: Department of Chemistry | Imperial College London
description: Worked with the Department of Chemistry at Imperial College London to develop a biosensor that could detect the Vancomycin concentration in blood plasma for an international competition which came third place. I led the engineering subgroup, managing both electrical engineers and biomedical engineers during the development process. My programming work involved creating an android application that implemented an image processing neural network that could determine the colour of lines on a Lateral Flow Assay. As part of this competition I represented Imperial College London internationally
